definition.name: Pull Request Comment Trigger fork
definition.description: Look for a "trigger word" in a pull-request description or comment, so that later steps can know whether or not to run.

inputs.name: reaction
inputs.description: If set, the specified emoji "reaction" is put on the comment to indicate that the trigger was detected. For example, "rocket".

inputs.name: trigger
inputs.description: The string to look for in pull-request descriptions and comments. For example "#build/android"

inputs.name: prefix_only
inputs.description: If 'true', the trigger must match the start of the comment.

outputs.name: triggered
outputs.description: the string 'true' if the trigger was found, otherwise the string 'false'

evidence.reasoning: This action focuses on detecting specific comments in pull requests, which is a form of communication. It also serves to trigger subsequent actions based on the presence of these comments, aligning with notification and testing categories.
